intro: Stahlianthus pedicellatus, commonly known as the Hawaiian flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy surface, and it thrives in coastal and moist forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
